sec.div: Area effect of suitable habitat on the number of social groups
sec.p: At the subpopulation level, the annual mean number of social groups was 4.29 ± 2.48 groups for the 6‐year period. For all subpopulations in the 12 subareas, the total area of available suitable habitats was positively correlated to the long‐term annual mean numbers of social groups ( R 2 = 0.652, F = 18.72, p = .001; Figure 3).

div.p: Long‐term mean group numbers plotted against the total area of suitable habitats for the 12 subpopulations in the 12 subareas
